ezechiel.gloss: a Hebrew prophet of the 6th century BC who was exiled to Babylon in 587 BC
an Old Testament book containing Ezekiel's prophecies of the downfall of Jerusalem and Judah and their subsequent restoration

ezed.gloss: the 26th letter of the Roman alphabet

ezekias.gloss: (Old Testament) king of Judah who abolished idolatry (715-687 BC)

ezekiel.gloss: a Hebrew prophet of the 6th century BC who was exiled to Babylon in 587 BC
an Old Testament book containing Ezekiel's prophecies of the downfall of Jerusalem and Judah and their subsequent restoration

ezo.gloss: the second largest of the four main islands of Japan

ezo-yama-hagi.gloss: Asian shrub having conspicuous racemose rose-purple flowers widely used as an ornamental and in erosion control and as a source of feed for wild birds

ezra.gloss: an Old Testament book telling of a rabbi's efforts in the 5th century BC to reconstitute Jewish law and worship in Jerusalem after the Babylonian Captivity

ezra cornell.gloss: United States businessman who unified the telegraph system in the United States and who in 1865 (with Andrew D. White) founded Cornell University (1807-1874)

ezra loomis pound.gloss: United States writer who lived in Europe
